meanings.sent1: The acerbic lemon made my face pucker up.
meanings.sent2: The vinegar had an acerbic flavor that made me cringe.
meanings.sent3: The acerbic apple was so sour, it made my eyes water.
meanings.sent4: The acerbic grapefruit was like a punch to the taste buds.
meanings.sent5: The acerbic taste of the unripe berries lingered on my tongue.

meanings.definition: Sharp or biting in tone or manner
meanings.sent1: Her acerbic remarks left everyone feeling uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The critic's acerbic review was scathing and harsh.
meanings.sent3: Despite his acerbic comments, he always managed to make us laugh.
meanings.sent4: The acerbic sarcasm in her voice cut through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: His acerbic wit could be both amusing and cutting at the same time.
